content.question: In an experiment, a solid, uniform cylinder of unknown radius <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and unknown rotational inertia <math alttext="I sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> about a central axle, is initially at rest. A light string is wrapped around the cylinder, as shown in the figure. The string is pulled with a constant unknown force <math alttext="F sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, causing the cylinder to rotate. After an unknown time interval <math alttext="delta t sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Î”</mi><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, the string is completely unwound from the pulley and loses contact with it. To collect data, a student has access to a meterstick, stopwatch, and force probe. The cylinder may rotate but cannot be moved off of its axle. Indicate whether the force applied to the cylinder <math alttext="F sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and the rotational inertia of the cylinder <math alttext="I sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> can be measured directly or calculated from measured quantities in the experiment.

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="I sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>Measured directlyMeasured directly

<math alttext="F sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="I sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>Measured directlyCalculated from measured quantities

<math alttext="F sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="I sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>Calculated from measured quantitiesMeasured directly

<math alttext="F sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="I sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>Calculated from measured quantitiesCalculated from measured quantities

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="I sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>Measured directlyCalculated from measured quantities

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
